newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Petrobras opens bids for Brazil, Bolivia pipeline.
newsitem.headline: Petrobras opens bids for Brazil, Bolivia pipeline.

text.p: Brazilian state-owned oil giant Petrobras has opened equipment bids for the $1.8 billion gas pipeline linking Bolivia's natural gas fields with Brazil's industrial heartland.
The company published an announcement in local newspapers, saying the tender prospectus for 500,000 metric tons of steel pipe would be available September 16.
Brazil and Bolivia signed an accord in Cochabamba, Bolivia, Wednesday to begin construction of the 1,900-mile (3,000 km) pipeline by the end of this year or early 1997.
The project, which has been stuck at various stages of planning since the 1950s, is expected to come online late 1998.
-- Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151
